title: 111_s2901
content:
The Act titled "Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009" establishes the Government-Wide Acquisition Management Fellows Program under the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 establishes a government-wide acquisition management fellows program to invest in the improvement of the Federal acquisition workforce by developing new leaders, recruiting individuals with academic merit and leadership skills, and offering advancement opportunities at executive agencies. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 establishes a program for government-wide acquisition management fellows. The program includes contracts with universities for training, consisting of one year on-campus and two years on-the-job. The curriculum involves rotational assignments at executive agencies and non-agency-specific training. The program for government-wide acquisition management fellows includes training at universities, emphasizing transparency, accountability, and integrity in the contracting process. Graduates receive priority for employment in executive agencies at GS-12, 13, or 14 levels. The program for government-wide acquisition management fellows limits the total number of participants to 200 per year, with a minimum of 50 in the first year, 100 in the second year, and 150 thereafter. The Administrator must collaborate with qualified universities for program administration and placement of graduates. The program for government-wide acquisition management fellows involves managing and overseeing the program, selecting and removing participants, reviewing career development, and requiring a commitment to federal service after completion. Participants must commit to working for the Federal Government in acquisition for a specified term. The OFPP Acquisition Fellows Program requires participants to commit to a minimum one-year term for each program year. Candidates who do not complete the program or meet service requirements must reimburse the Federal Government. A fund called the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund is established for program operations, including covering expenses like tuition and room and board. The OFPP Acquisition Fellows Program establishes the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund to cover expenses such as tuition, room and board, travel, stipends, program administration, and other necessary expenses. The Fund is funded by appropriations or other available amounts. The Government-wide acquisition management fellows program under section 45 of the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act requires the Administrator to submit an initial report within 120 days of enactment, detailing the program and its five-year budget. Additionally, annual reports are mandated, including information on program activities, participant numbers, training provided, and an assessment of effectiveness. The Administrator must submit reports on the acquisition management fellows program, detailing program activities, participant numbers, training provided, effectiveness assessment, and recommendations for legislative or administrative action. Appropriate congressional committees are defined, and authorization of appropriations is specified for the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund. Authorization of Appropriations for the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund:
- $16,000,000 for fiscal year 2011
- $32,000,000 for fiscal year 2012
- $48,000,000 for fiscal year 2013.
